constituent: godown, meeting, single gate, umbrella, stable door, mouth
heisigStory: The single gate is used here not in order to represent one gate, but many of them, indeed a meeting of gates. Add mouth (as an entrance here) and you end up with godown. That should help keep this character distinct from warehouse (Frame 633).
koohiiStory1: A godown is a dockside warehouse. This is actually a meeting of large doors and mouths. The stroke order is the same as door, not gates, just with the top stroke moved down into the now larger door.
koohiiStory2: Note: this is not gate but actually a variation of door and is written as such, with the vertical stroke last not first.
